title: newSocial Media Manager
description:
The H.B.P.A. is an organization that provides the Thoroughbred horsemen with an authoritative, united voice providing representation in the conduct of Horse racing. The H.B.P.A. serves to protect and maintain the interests of the owners, trainers, and employees who have an investment in the multi-million dollar Thoroughbred Racing industry.

The HBPA of Alberta is searching for a dynamic social media manager to assist with promoting live racing and to showcase our equine athletes for the world to see. This individual will be energetic, self motivated and able to think for themselves. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience with Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Tik Tok, Snapchat and Canva. The perfect candidate will also have a working knowledge of the Thoroughbred Horse racing industry and be able to present our product in a positive light.

Experience
-proven track record of creating engaging content in channels including Blog posts, all proven social media channels and email campaigns.

-Highly efficient in research, writing, and editing social media posts that create an engaged audience through consistent posting of relevant materials

-Detail orientated and can edit and ensure proper grammar, format, Tone and style for all social media posts.

-ability to work collaboratively and effectively with a Board of directors, Executive Director and other staff members to develop and execute specific strategies.

-Results orientated self-starter with the ability to work independently when required.

This position will be a paid contract position for the 2022 racing season with the possibility to renew the contract for the 2023 racing season.

Job Type: Fixed term contract
Contract length: 8 months

Salary: $14.00-$33.00 per hour

Experience:

  • Marketing: 1 year (preferred)

Expected start date: 2022-05-01

title: Standardbred Racing Internship
description:
Our rich history is a big part of who we are. With historic roots dating back over 135 years, Woodbine is steeped in tradition. We have been the engine that drives the Ontario horse racing industry. From King’s and Queen’s trips to Canada, anniversaries and unforgettable horse races, we have been creating winning experiences for all our guests.

We are currently on an amazing 20-year journey to ‘build a city within a city’ and transform the largest privately held land in Toronto into one of Canada’s premiere entertainment destinations. This journey will unlock the value of approximately 700 acres of land, leading to job creation and the revitalization of our communities, while enhancing our ability to share the thrill of horse-racing and cementing our place as an entertainment powerhouse.
We need dedicated people to join our cause. Be part of Woodbine Entertainment and get inspired to make work awesome!

Our Values & Beliefs
| WOW EVERY GUEST | OWN IT! | LISTEN & CONNECT – PEOPLE MATTER | FUEL THE FUN & PASS IT ON | TRUST IN OUR TEAM | #WE CARE | PURSUE YOUR POTENTIAL |BE BOLD| BE ALL IN |

Woodbine has a new and exciting opportunity that we would like to share. We are launching our Standardbred Racing Internship Program for our 2022 season. This is a temporary assignment and is an amazing opportunity for team members to pursue their potential and experience the thrill of horse-racing first-hand.

The successful incumbents will spend an exciting 16 weeks working in all facets of the Racing Department to better understand Standardbred Racing and the day-to-day running of both the Racing Operations and our Race Office. This program aims to expose team members to the world of racing to learn more about the industry and possibly open the door for more career opportunities in the future. The hourly wage rate for this internship will be $18 per hour, working 40 hours per week.

Reporting to the Senior Manager, Racing Operations, this Internship within the Standardbred Racing department will provide support to multiple areas over a 16 week period. This position will be provided with an introduction to Standardbred Racing, while learning race office management and race night operations.

Responsibilities

  • Observe the work of departmental subject matter experts and make note of best practices and main accountabilities
  • Develop and maintain a professional relationship with internal departments including Printing, Guest Experience, Marketing and Media, and external clients such as trainers, owners, and the Alcohol and Gaming Commission of Ontario
  • Assist the Race Office. Duties may include, but will not be limited to, taking horse entries from trainers/owners for races. Ensure horses that have been entered into the race are not on any lists (vet, starter, and/or judges) and are able to compete in the specified race.
  • Assist the Staking Manager when needed. Duties may include, but will not be limited to, entering all nominating & sustaining horses, prepare lists of horses eligible to WEG & Alliance Stakes. Ensure all payments are balanced, and purses for all added money events are correct
  • Assist the Bookkeeper when needed. Duties may include, but will not be limited to, entering race results in InCompass, printing, balancing and delivering WEG & Alliance cheques
  • Learn race night operations including Charter, Placing Judge as well as paddock operations
  • Assist on major race nights with owners and any requests they may have to ensure they have a world class experience on site
  • Organize and promote any major or special events as required

Key Success factors

  • 1-2 years experience working in a customer service environment an asset
  • Strong organizational and administrative skills
  • Ability to exchange information clearly and concisely
  • Must have good time management and multitasking skills
  • Able to work efficiently as a part of a team as well as independently
  • Excellent customer service skills
  • Basic knowledge of Microsoft programs
Guided by our Values and Beliefs, Woodbine Entertainment commits to providing an authentic and empowering work experience! Please reach out if you're ready to embrace change and be part of a new breed of experience while working for one of Canada’s certified Great Places to Work!

title: Thoroughbred Racing Internship
description:
Our rich history is a big part of who we are. With historic roots dating back over 135 years, Woodbine is steeped in tradition. We have been the engine that drives the Ontario horse racing industry. From King’s and Queen’s trips to Canada, anniversaries and unforgettable horse races, we have been creating winning experiences for all our guests.

We are currently on an amazing 20-year journey to ‘build a city within a city’ and transform the largest privately held land in Toronto into one of Canada’s premiere entertainment destinations. This journey will unlock the value of approximately 700 acres of land, leading to job creation and the revitalization of our communities, while enhancing our ability to share the thrill of horse-racing and cementing our place as an entertainment powerhouse.
We need dedicated people to join our cause. Be part of Woodbine Entertainment and get inspired to make work awesome!

Our Values & Beliefs
| WOW EVERY GUEST | OWN IT! | LISTEN & CONNECT – PEOPLE MATTER | FUEL THE FUN & PASS IT ON | TRUST IN OUR TEAM | #WE CARE | PURSUE YOUR POTENTIAL |BE BOLD| BE ALL IN |

Woodbine has an exciting opportunity available in the Thoroughbred Racing Department. After a very successful first year, we are opening the Thoroughbred Racing Internship Program for 2022. This is a temporary assignment open to internal and external candidates to experience the thrill of horse racing first hand while pursuing your potential.

The successful incumbents will spend an exciting 16 weeks working in all facets of the Racing Department to better understand Thoroughbred Racing and the day-to-day running of both the Racing Operations and our Race Office. This program aims to expose those interested in working in the equine industry to learn more about the thoroughbred racing industry and possibly open the door for more career opportunities in the future. The hourly wage rate for this internship will be $18 per hour, working 40 hours per week.
We will also be posting a similar opportunity for our Standardbred Team in the coming months so stay tuned.

Duties:

  • Observe the work of departmental subject matter experts and make note of best practices and main accountabilities
  • Assist with entries for the race card, which includes confirming race information, ensuring eligibility, applying applicable AGCO regulations and communicating with owners and trainers
  • Greeting and directing office visitors, drafting routine correspondence, meeting minutes and basic spreadsheets.
  • Maintain a professional relationship with internal departments including Printing, Guest Experience, Marketing and Media, and external clients such as trainers, owners, the Alcohol and Gaming Commission of Ontario, jockeys, and agents
  • Assist with horse concierge program particularly on major race days
  • Implementation and production of various statistical reports as required by management
  • Act as a Racing Ambassador by providing information to owners on licensing requirements and horse certificates
  • Assist with conducting barn audits and provide support to Racing Surfaces team as required
  • Other related duties as assigned

Key Success Factors

  • High School degree or relevant knowledge of the Racing Industry
  • A passion to learn more about the horse racing industry
  • Basic skills in Microsoft Suite
  • Demonstrated collaborative skills and ability to work well within a team
  • Ability to prioritize, multi-task and manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Strong organizational and administrative skills
  • Ability to exchange information clearly and concisely
  • Flexibility to work different hours and days as needed for the internship, including weekends and holidays.
  • Internship includes working indoors and outdoors depending on the work area during placement.

Program Overview

Introduction to TB Racing – 1 week

  • History and Culture of Racing
  • Safety around Horses with backstretch tours
  • Racing structure breakdown with a meet and greet in each area
  • The lifecycle of a TB Racehorse with a discussion on Equine Welfare as well as a farm tour

Race Office – 8 weeks

  • Race Office Front Desk – learn essential tasks and day to day requirements of horse racing stakeholders
  • Race Office Clerk/Data Entry – learn the InCompass System, take entries and get familiar with process to ensure all horses are eligible to race
  • Assistant Race Secretary – learn the role of the Assistant Racing Secretary and the process of putting together a racing program and preparing the race card
  • Stakes Manager – will learn how stakes nominations are obtained and the day to day running of the stakes department to create the stakes program
  • Race Secretary – will learn the day to day responsibilities including how to create a condition book and decisions on which races are to be carded daily

Horse and Race Logistics - 2 Weeks

  • Stall Office Management – will learn the day to day operations of the Stall Office
  • Clockers – will work with the clockers to see how the horses are timed during morning workouts and the job of the sheet writer
  • Start Gate – will view the day to day work done by the Head Starter and his crew. This will be viewed at both morning training hours and race hours
  • Track Surfaces – will follow the track surfaces team during morning training hours to see work done on tracks to prepare for racing and upkeep of other surfaces

  • Racing Operations – 5 weeks
  • Racing Concierge Services – learn how to provide a winning experience to Owners and Trainers
  • Clerk of Scales/ Jockey Room – will learn the work of the Clerk of the Scales and respective team which includes ensuring the Jockey’s Room is prepared for each day of racing and all rules and regulations are followed during each race day
  • Paddock operations (Placing Judge/ Paddock Judge/Horse ID) – Learn day to day responsibilities of each position
  • Racing Operations Senior Manager – learn position’s day to day responsibilities including the importance of Equine Welfare as it pertains to the racing industry

Guided by our Values and Beliefs, Woodbine Entertainment commits to providing an authentic and empowering work experience! Please reach out if you're ready to embrace change and be part of a new breed of experience while working for one of Canada’s certified Great Places to Work!

title: newRacing Coordinator
description:
Our rich history is a big part of who we are. With historic roots dating back over 135 years, Woodbine is steeped in tradition. We have been the engine that drives the Ontario horse racing industry. From King’s and Queen’s trips to Canada, anniversaries and unforgettable horse races, we have been creating winning experiences for all our guests.

We are currently on an amazing 20-year journey to ‘build a city within a city’ and transform the largest privately held land in Toronto into one of Canada’s premiere entertainment destinations. This journey will unlock the value of approximately 700 acres of land, leading to job creation and the revitalization of our communities, while enhancing our ability to share the thrill of horse-racing and cementing our place as an entertainment powerhouse.
We need dedicated people to join our cause. Be part of Woodbine Entertainment and get inspired to make work awesome!

Our Values & Beliefs
| WOW EVERY GUEST | OWN IT! | LISTEN & CONNECT – PEOPLE MATTER | FUEL THE FUN & PASS IT ON | TRUST IN OUR TEAM | #WE CARE | PURSUE YOUR POTENTIAL |BE BOLD| BE ALL IN |

JOB SUMMARY

Reporting to the Racing Secretary, The purpose of this position is to take entries for race cards, which includes ensuring confirming race information, ensuring eligibility, communicating with owners and trainers, operating the race office during live racing. This This position will also assist in backfilling key roles in the department including, but not limited to, Charter and Placing Judge.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Responsible for taking horse entries from trainers/owners for races via telephone or direct face to face contact. Use information from condition sheet to confirm race information (race date & condition eligibility)
  • Ensure horses that have been entered into the race are not on any lists (vet, starter, and/or judges) and are able to compete in the specified race.
  • Once the race draw is complete, responsible for ensuring that all horses have been assigned a post position and race number, and that all information for the horse/race is accurate.
  • Contact trainers directly should any discrepancies or problems with entry arise.
  • Assist with producing an “overnight”; a listing of specific race information, and ensure enough supply is available for customers, owners, trainers.
  • Responsible for analyzing past performances for each horse, ensuring that each entry is eligible to race and that they are adhering to Alcohol and Gaming Commission of Ontario guidelines.
  • Using InCompass ensure accounts have been created for each horse, trainer, driver, owner
  • Fill in as required for Charter & Placing Judge
  • Prepare the race charts for the evening noting driver changes, claims, track condition, mutuel prices and temperature.
  • Chart each horse’s position during racing using binoculars, voice recorder and or television monitor or using Woodbine’s GPS tracking system
  • Work with the Alcohol and Gaming Commission of Ontario to confirm any scratches, ensuring regulations are being followed.
  • Maintain a professional relationship with internal departments including Printing, Customer Services, Marketing and Media, and external clients such as trainers, drivers, owners and the Alcohol and Gaming Commission of Ontario.
  • Lead by example, to exhibit, encourage and motivate WEG’s Values and Beliefs

Qualifications:

Knowledge
  • General to advanced knowledge of the horse racing industry
  • General knowledge of horse racing rules and regulations
  • Shall obtain proper Licenses as required to fulfill the function under the AGCO rules

Skills
  • Advance attention to detail.
  • General communication, interpersonal and organizational skills are required to interact effectively with all levels of staff, horse trainers and owners.
  • General computer skills in a Windows environment
  • General ability to work in a fast-paced, team environment.

Education & Experience
  • Ontario Secondary School Diploma
  • 1-2 years office experience

Guided by our Values and Beliefs, Woodbine Entertainment commits to providing an authentic and empowering work experience! Please reach out if you're ready to embrace change and be part of a new breed of experience while working for one of Canada’s certified Great Places to Work!

title: newEquine Territory Sales Representative for CWD - Ontario (Can...
description:
CWD is the #1 brand in French saddlery and partner to the world's top riders including McLain Ward, Kent Farrington, Sam Walker, Hyde Moffat, Mac Cone. With the growth of our cutting-edge technology in the 2Gs saddle we are currently looking for a Sales Representative for West/Centrale Ontario (Canada).

Why you? Because you have:

  • At least one successful experienced in field sales (record and reference will be asked)
  • You have a clean driving record
  • Excellent communication and people skills
  • Full knowledge and understanding of English riding industry and horseshows
  • Strong organizational skills and are a mature, independent and dynamic person
  • You are a passionate rider that understands equine health care and sport expectation
  • The travel bug and enjoy being on the road!

Your missions:

  • Become the most talented expert in sport saddles within your territory
  • Develop and manage your customer base independently (Amateurs, Trainers, Pro-Riders, Barns)
  • Represent CWD at international and local competitions
  • Create a unique experience for clients through your knowledge and best-in-class customer service

Be a brand ambassador of CWD!

WHY CWD?

Do you enjoy working in an international environment? At CWD, we offer you the opportunity to work for a dynamic, market leading saddlery company with expertise in crafting custom saddles and tack. Thanks to our training institute, you will gain knowledge relating to saddle fitting, leather, horse biomechanics and sales.

CWD is one-of-a-kind in the equine industry! Our successful employees stay with us many years!

  • Following a ramp-up period*, you will receive a fixed salary and unlimited commission potential.
  • You will also have a company car + a gas card + iPhone and IPad.
  • We offer personal health
  • If you are still riding and competing, we can ride in a custom demo saddle
  • We offer a competent, supportive and caring leadership with frequent visits and team meetings

CWD offers you a career in sales with lots of interaction with customers and their horses.

You can have it all! Do you have what it takes to be a successful sales representative for CWD saddles? Apply now!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $50,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Paid time off

Schedule:

  • Day shift

Application question(s):

  • What disciplines do you practice?

Experience:

  • Equine industry: 3 years (preferred)
  • Outside sales: 3 years (preferred)

  • Equine industry: 3 years (preferred)
  • Outside sales: 3 years (preferred)

title: Blacksmith
description:
Our rich history is a big part of who we are. With historic roots dating back over 135 years, Woodbine is steeped in tradition. We have been the engine that drives the Ontario horse racing industry. From King’s and Queen’s trips to Canada, anniversaries and unforgettable horse races, we have been creating winning experiences for all our guests.

We are currently on an amazing 20-year journey to ‘build a city within a city’ and transform the largest privately held land in Toronto into one of Canada’s premiere entertainment destinations. This journey will unlock the value of approximately 700 acres of land, leading to job creation and the revitalization of our communities, while enhancing our ability to share the thrill of horse-racing and cementing our place as an entertainment powerhouse.
We need dedicated people to join our cause. Be part of Woodbine Entertainment and get inspired to make work awesome!

Our Values & Beliefs
| WOW EVERY GUEST | OWN IT! | LISTEN & CONNECT – PEOPLE MATTER | FUEL THE FUN & PASS IT ON | TRUST IN OUR TEAM | #WE CARE | PURSUE YOUR POTENTIAL |BE BOLD| BE ALL IN |

This position is responsible for ensuring each horse entering the paddock for racing is properly shod and to replace a shoe where necessary.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Removes worn or defective shoe from hoof
  • Examines hoof to detect bruises and cracks and to determine trimming required
  • Selects aluminum or steel shoe from stock, according to hoof measurements and animal usage
  • Nails shoe to hoof and files hoof flush with shoe
  • Responsible for driving the horse ambulance should an accident or incident occur where it is needed on property
  • Other duties may be assigned

JOB SPECIFICATIONS:

  • Up to two years related experience or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • General to advanced knowledge of the horse racing industry
  • General knowledge of horse racing rules and regulations
  • Advance attention to detail.
  • General communication, interpersonal and organizational skills are required to interact effectively with all levels of staff and horse trainers.
  • General ability to work in a fast-paced, team environment
  • Displays willingness to make decisions
  • Exhibits sound and accurate judgment
  • Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness
  • Monitors own work to ensure quality
  • Observes safety and security procedures
  • Follows instructions, responds to management direction
Guided by our Values and Beliefs, Woodbine Entertainment commits to providing an authentic and empowering work experience! Please reach out if you're ready to embrace change and be part of a new breed of experience while working for one of Canada’s certified Great Places to Work!

title: Saddle Expert & Sales Representative
description:
About Voltaire Design:

Voltaire Design is one of the world’s leading companies in saddle manufacturing, performing operations in over 17 countries. With its heart and primary workshop in the marvelous town of Bidart, located in the southwest of France, Voltaire Design relies on the long French tradition of saddle making. Voltaire Design is the first saddle maker incorporating fashion into its products and also the first environmentally-friendly saddler in the world.

All employees share the same enthusiasm and passion of well-made work and craftsmanship.

Due to expansion of our brand, Voltaire Design is recruiting a new Sport Saddle Specialist for our Alberta territory.

Responsibilities and Duties

  • Represent our brand and develop sales within your territory
  • Be present at all selected Horse Shows, actively searching for new sales opportunities and bringing care to your customers (riders, trainers, barns…) through fittings
  • Manage your inventory of saddles and accessories in a careful and organized manner.

Benefits

  • Base salary & commission structure
  • Health insurance
  • Company car & trailer
  • iPhone & iPad
  • Sales training (two weeks)

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Pay: From $50,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Commission pay

Benefits:

  • Paid time off

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Experience:

  • Outside sales: 3 years (preferred)
  • equestrian: 3 years (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Driving Licence (required)

Willingness to travel:

  • 75% (preferred)

title: Social Media Manager
description:
The H.B.P.A. is an organization that provides the Thoroughbred horsemen with an authoritative, united voice providing representation in the conduct of Horse racing. The H.B.P.A. serves to protect and maintain the interests of the owners, trainers, and employees who have an investment in the multi-million dollar Thoroughbred Racing industry.

The HBPA of Alberta is searching for a dynamic social media manager to assist with promoting live racing and to showcase our equine athletes for the world to see. This individual will be energetic, self motivated and able to think for themselves. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience with Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Tik Tok, Snapchat and Canva. The perfect candidate will also have a working knowledge of the Thoroughbred Horse racing industry and be able to present our product in a positive light.

Experience
-proven track record of creating engaging content in channels including Blog posts, all proven social media channels and email campaigns.

-Highly efficient in research, writing, and editing social media posts that create an engaged audience through consistent posting of relevant materials

-Detail orientated and can edit and ensure proper grammar, format, Tone and style for all social media posts.

-ability to work collaboratively and effectively with a Board of directors, Executive Director and other staff members to develop and execute specific strategies.

-Results orientated self-starter with the ability to work independently when required.

This position will be a paid contract position for the 2022 racing season with the possibility to renew the contract for the 2023 racing season.

Job Type: Fixed term contract
Contract length: 8 months

Salary: $14.00-$33.00 per hour

Experience:

  • Marketing: 1 year (preferred)

Expected start date: 2022-05-01

title: Standardbred Racing Internship
description:
Our rich history is a big part of who we are. With historic roots dating back over 135 years, Woodbine is steeped in tradition. We have been the engine that drives the Ontario horse racing industry. From King’s and Queen’s trips to Canada, anniversaries and unforgettable horse races, we have been creating winning experiences for all our guests.

We are currently on an amazing 20-year journey to ‘build a city within a city’ and transform the largest privately held land in Toronto into one of Canada’s premiere entertainment destinations. This journey will unlock the value of approximately 700 acres of land, leading to job creation and the revitalization of our communities, while enhancing our ability to share the thrill of horse-racing and cementing our place as an entertainment powerhouse.
We need dedicated people to join our cause. Be part of Woodbine Entertainment and get inspired to make work awesome!

Our Values & Beliefs
| WOW EVERY GUEST | OWN IT! | LISTEN & CONNECT – PEOPLE MATTER | FUEL THE FUN & PASS IT ON | TRUST IN OUR TEAM | #WE CARE | PURSUE YOUR POTENTIAL |BE BOLD| BE ALL IN |

Woodbine has a new and exciting opportunity that we would like to share. We are launching our Standardbred Racing Internship Program for our 2022 season. This is a temporary assignment and is an amazing opportunity for team members to pursue their potential and experience the thrill of horse-racing first-hand.

The successful incumbents will spend an exciting 16 weeks working in all facets of the Racing Department to better understand Standardbred Racing and the day-to-day running of both the Racing Operations and our Race Office. This program aims to expose team members to the world of racing to learn more about the industry and possibly open the door for more career opportunities in the future. The hourly wage rate for this internship will be $18 per hour, working 40 hours per week.

Reporting to the Senior Manager, Racing Operations, this Internship within the Standardbred Racing department will provide support to multiple areas over a 16 week period. This position will be provided with an introduction to Standardbred Racing, while learning race office management and race night operations.

Responsibilities

  • Observe the work of departmental subject matter experts and make note of best practices and main accountabilities
  • Develop and maintain a professional relationship with internal departments including Printing, Guest Experience, Marketing and Media, and external clients such as trainers, owners, and the Alcohol and Gaming Commission of Ontario
  • Assist the Race Office. Duties may include, but will not be limited to, taking horse entries from trainers/owners for races. Ensure horses that have been entered into the race are not on any lists (vet, starter, and/or judges) and are able to compete in the specified race.
  • Assist the Staking Manager when needed. Duties may include, but will not be limited to, entering all nominating & sustaining horses, prepare lists of horses eligible to WEG & Alliance Stakes. Ensure all payments are balanced, and purses for all added money events are correct
  • Assist the Bookkeeper when needed. Duties may include, but will not be limited to, entering race results in InCompass, printing, balancing and delivering WEG & Alliance cheques
  • Learn race night operations including Charter, Placing Judge as well as paddock operations
  • Assist on major race nights with owners and any requests they may have to ensure they have a world class experience on site
  • Organize and promote any major or special events as required

Key Success factors

  • 1-2 years experience working in a customer service environment an asset
  • Strong organizational and administrative skills
  • Ability to exchange information clearly and concisely
  • Must have good time management and multitasking skills
  • Able to work efficiently as a part of a team as well as independently
  • Excellent customer service skills
  • Basic knowledge of Microsoft programs
Guided by our Values and Beliefs, Woodbine Entertainment commits to providing an authentic and empowering work experience! Please reach out if you're ready to embrace change and be part of a new breed of experience while working for one of Canada’s certified Great Places to Work!

title: Thoroughbred Racing Internship
description:
Our rich history is a big part of who we are. With historic roots dating back over 135 years, Woodbine is steeped in tradition. We have been the engine that drives the Ontario horse racing industry. From King’s and Queen’s trips to Canada, anniversaries and unforgettable horse races, we have been creating winning experiences for all our guests.

We are currently on an amazing 20-year journey to ‘build a city within a city’ and transform the largest privately held land in Toronto into one of Canada’s premiere entertainment destinations. This journey will unlock the value of approximately 700 acres of land, leading to job creation and the revitalization of our communities, while enhancing our ability to share the thrill of horse-racing and cementing our place as an entertainment powerhouse.
We need dedicated people to join our cause. Be part of Woodbine Entertainment and get inspired to make work awesome!

Our Values & Beliefs
| WOW EVERY GUEST | OWN IT! | LISTEN & CONNECT – PEOPLE MATTER | FUEL THE FUN & PASS IT ON | TRUST IN OUR TEAM | #WE CARE | PURSUE YOUR POTENTIAL |BE BOLD| BE ALL IN |

Woodbine has an exciting opportunity available in the Thoroughbred Racing Department. After a very successful first year, we are opening the Thoroughbred Racing Internship Program for 2022. This is a temporary assignment open to internal and external candidates to experience the thrill of horse racing first hand while pursuing your potential.

The successful incumbents will spend an exciting 16 weeks working in all facets of the Racing Department to better understand Thoroughbred Racing and the day-to-day running of both the Racing Operations and our Race Office. This program aims to expose those interested in working in the equine industry to learn more about the thoroughbred racing industry and possibly open the door for more career opportunities in the future. The hourly wage rate for this internship will be $18 per hour, working 40 hours per week.
We will also be posting a similar opportunity for our Standardbred Team in the coming months so stay tuned.

Duties:

  • Observe the work of departmental subject matter experts and make note of best practices and main accountabilities
  • Assist with entries for the race card, which includes confirming race information, ensuring eligibility, applying applicable AGCO regulations and communicating with owners and trainers
  • Greeting and directing office visitors, drafting routine correspondence, meeting minutes and basic spreadsheets.
  • Maintain a professional relationship with internal departments including Printing, Guest Experience, Marketing and Media, and external clients such as trainers, owners, the Alcohol and Gaming Commission of Ontario, jockeys, and agents
  • Assist with horse concierge program particularly on major race days
  • Implementation and production of various statistical reports as required by management
  • Act as a Racing Ambassador by providing information to owners on licensing requirements and horse certificates
  • Assist with conducting barn audits and provide support to Racing Surfaces team as required
  • Other related duties as assigned

Key Success Factors

  • High School degree or relevant knowledge of the Racing Industry
  • A passion to learn more about the horse racing industry
  • Basic skills in Microsoft Suite
  • Demonstrated collaborative skills and ability to work well within a team
  • Ability to prioritize, multi-task and manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Strong organizational and administrative skills
  • Ability to exchange information clearly and concisely
  • Flexibility to work different hours and days as needed for the internship, including weekends and holidays.
  • Internship includes working indoors and outdoors depending on the work area during placement.

Program Overview

Introduction to TB Racing – 1 week

  • History and Culture of Racing
  • Safety around Horses with backstretch tours
  • Racing structure breakdown with a meet and greet in each area
  • The lifecycle of a TB Racehorse with a discussion on Equine Welfare as well as a farm tour

Race Office – 8 weeks

  • Race Office Front Desk – learn essential tasks and day to day requirements of horse racing stakeholders
  • Race Office Clerk/Data Entry – learn the InCompass System, take entries and get familiar with process to ensure all horses are eligible to race
  • Assistant Race Secretary – learn the role of the Assistant Racing Secretary and the process of putting together a racing program and preparing the race card
  • Stakes Manager – will learn how stakes nominations are obtained and the day to day running of the stakes department to create the stakes program
  • Race Secretary – will learn the day to day responsibilities including how to create a condition book and decisions on which races are to be carded daily

Horse and Race Logistics - 2 Weeks

  • Stall Office Management – will learn the day to day operations of the Stall Office
  • Clockers – will work with the clockers to see how the horses are timed during morning workouts and the job of the sheet writer
  • Start Gate – will view the day to day work done by the Head Starter and his crew. This will be viewed at both morning training hours and race hours
  • Track Surfaces – will follow the track surfaces team during morning training hours to see work done on tracks to prepare for racing and upkeep of other surfaces

  • Racing Operations – 5 weeks
  • Racing Concierge Services – learn how to provide a winning experience to Owners and Trainers
  • Clerk of Scales/ Jockey Room – will learn the work of the Clerk of the Scales and respective team which includes ensuring the Jockey’s Room is prepared for each day of racing and all rules and regulations are followed during each race day
  • Paddock operations (Placing Judge/ Paddock Judge/Horse ID) – Learn day to day responsibilities of each position
  • Racing Operations Senior Manager – learn position’s day to day responsibilities including the importance of Equine Welfare as it pertains to the racing industry

Guided by our Values and Beliefs, Woodbine Entertainment commits to providing an authentic and empowering work experience! Please reach out if you're ready to embrace change and be part of a new breed of experience while working for one of Canada’s certified Great Places to Work!
Show more

title: Racing Coordinator
description:
Our rich history is a big part of who we are. With historic roots dating back over 135 years, Woodbine is steeped in tradition. We have been the engine that drives the Ontario horse racing industry. From King’s and Queen’s trips to Canada, anniversaries and unforgettable horse races, we have been creating winning experiences for all our guests.

We are currently on an amazing 20-year journey to ‘build a city within a city’ and transform the largest privately held land in Toronto into one of Canada’s premiere entertainment destinations. This journey will unlock the value of approximately 700 acres of land, leading to job creation and the revitalization of our communities, while enhancing our ability to share the thrill of horse-racing and cementing our place as an entertainment powerhouse.
We need dedicated people to join our cause. Be part of Woodbine Entertainment and get inspired to make work awesome!

Our Values & Beliefs
| WOW EVERY GUEST | OWN IT! | LISTEN & CONNECT – PEOPLE MATTER | FUEL THE FUN & PASS IT ON | TRUST IN OUR TEAM | #WE CARE | PURSUE YOUR POTENTIAL |BE BOLD| BE ALL IN |

JOB SUMMARY

Reporting to the Racing Secretary, The purpose of this position is to take entries for race cards, which includes ensuring confirming race information, ensuring eligibility, communicating with owners and trainers, operating the race office during live racing. This This position will also assist in backfilling key roles in the department including, but not limited to, Charter and Placing Judge.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Responsible for taking horse entries from trainers/owners for races via telephone or direct face to face contact. Use information from condition sheet to confirm race information (race date & condition eligibility)
  • Ensure horses that have been entered into the race are not on any lists (vet, starter, and/or judges) and are able to compete in the specified race.
  • Once the race draw is complete, responsible for ensuring that all horses have been assigned a post position and race number, and that all information for the horse/race is accurate.
  • Contact trainers directly should any discrepancies or problems with entry arise.
  • Assist with producing an “overnight”; a listing of specific race information, and ensure enough supply is available for customers, owners, trainers.
  • Responsible for analyzing past performances for each horse, ensuring that each entry is eligible to race and that they are adhering to Alcohol and Gaming Commission of Ontario guidelines.
  • Using InCompass ensure accounts have been created for each horse, trainer, driver, owner
  • Fill in as required for Charter & Placing Judge
  • Prepare the race charts for the evening noting driver changes, claims, track condition, mutuel prices and temperature.
  • Chart each horse’s position during racing using binoculars, voice recorder and or television monitor or using Woodbine’s GPS tracking system
  • Work with the Alcohol and Gaming Commission of Ontario to confirm any scratches, ensuring regulations are being followed.
  • Maintain a professional relationship with internal departments including Printing, Customer Services, Marketing and Media, and external clients such as trainers, drivers, owners and the Alcohol and Gaming Commission of Ontario.
  • Lead by example, to exhibit, encourage and motivate WEG’s Values and Beliefs

Qualifications:

Knowledge
  • General to advanced knowledge of the horse racing industry
  • General knowledge of horse racing rules and regulations
  • Shall obtain proper Licenses as required to fulfill the function under the AGCO rules

Skills
  • Advance attention to detail.
  • General communication, interpersonal and organizational skills are required to interact effectively with all levels of staff, horse trainers and owners.
  • General computer skills in a Windows environment
  • General ability to work in a fast-paced, team environment.

Education & Experience
  • Ontario Secondary School Diploma
  • 1-2 years office experience

Guided by our Values and Beliefs, Woodbine Entertainment commits to providing an authentic and empowering work experience! Please reach out if you're ready to embrace change and be part of a new breed of experience while working for one of Canada’s certified Great Places to Work!

title: Equine Territory Sales Representative for CWD - Ontario (Canada)
description:
CWD is the #1 brand in French saddlery and partner to the world's top riders including McLain Ward, Kent Farrington, Sam Walker, Hyde Moffat, Mac Cone. With the growth of our cutting-edge technology in the 2Gs saddle we are currently looking for a Sales Representative for West/Centrale Ontario (Canada).

Why you? Because you have:

  • At least one successful experienced in field sales (record and reference will be asked)
  • You have a clean driving record
  • Excellent communication and people skills
  • Full knowledge and understanding of English riding industry and horseshows
  • Strong organizational skills and are a mature, independent and dynamic person
  • You are a passionate rider that understands equine health care and sport expectation
  • The travel bug and enjoy being on the road!

Your missions:

  • Become the most talented expert in sport saddles within your territory
  • Develop and manage your customer base independently (Amateurs, Trainers, Pro-Riders, Barns)
  • Represent CWD at international and local competitions
  • Create a unique experience for clients through your knowledge and best-in-class customer service

Be a brand ambassador of CWD!

WHY CWD?

Do you enjoy working in an international environment? At CWD, we offer you the opportunity to work for a dynamic, market leading saddlery company with expertise in crafting custom saddles and tack. Thanks to our training institute, you will gain knowledge relating to saddle fitting, leather, horse biomechanics and sales.

CWD is one-of-a-kind in the equine industry! Our successful employees stay with us many years!

  • Following a ramp-up period*, you will receive a fixed salary and unlimited commission potential.
  • You will also have a company car + a gas card + iPhone and IPad.
  • We offer personal health
  • If you are still riding and competing, we can ride in a custom demo saddle
  • We offer a competent, supportive and caring leadership with frequent visits and team meetings

CWD offers you a career in sales with lots of interaction with customers and their horses.

You can have it all! Do you have what it takes to be a successful sales representative for CWD saddles? Apply now!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $50,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Paid time off

Schedule:

  • Day shift

Application question(s):

  • What disciplines do you practice?

Experience:

  • Equine industry: 3 years (preferred)
  • Outside sales: 3 years (preferred)
Show more

title: Blacksmith
description:
Our rich history is a big part of who we are. With historic roots dating back over 135 years, Woodbine is steeped in tradition. We have been the engine that drives the Ontario horse racing industry. From King’s and Queen’s trips to Canada, anniversaries and unforgettable horse races, we have been creating winning experiences for all our guests.

We are currently on an amazing 20-year journey to ‘build a city within a city’ and transform the largest privately held land in Toronto into one of Canada’s premiere entertainment destinations. This journey will unlock the value of approximately 700 acres of land, leading to job creation and the revitalization of our communities, while enhancing our ability to share the thrill of horse-racing and cementing our place as an entertainment powerhouse.
We need dedicated people to join our cause. Be part of Woodbine Entertainment and get inspired to make work awesome!

Our Values & Beliefs
| WOW EVERY GUEST | OWN IT! | LISTEN & CONNECT – PEOPLE MATTER | FUEL THE FUN & PASS IT ON | TRUST IN OUR TEAM | #WE CARE | PURSUE YOUR POTENTIAL |BE BOLD| BE ALL IN |

This position is responsible for ensuring each horse entering the paddock for racing is properly shod and to replace a shoe where necessary.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Removes worn or defective shoe from hoof
  • Examines hoof to detect bruises and cracks and to determine trimming required
  • Selects aluminum or steel shoe from stock, according to hoof measurements and animal usage
  • Nails shoe to hoof and files hoof flush with shoe
  • Responsible for driving the horse ambulance should an accident or incident occur where it is needed on property
  • Other duties may be assigned

JOB SPECIFICATIONS:

  • Up to two years related experience or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • General to advanced knowledge of the horse racing industry
  • General knowledge of horse racing rules and regulations
  • Advance attention to detail.
  • General communication, interpersonal and organizational skills are required to interact effectively with all levels of staff and horse trainers.
  • General ability to work in a fast-paced, team environment
  • Displays willingness to make decisions
  • Exhibits sound and accurate judgment
  • Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness
  • Monitors own work to ensure quality
  • Observes safety and security procedures
  • Follows instructions, responds to management direction
Guided by our Values and Beliefs, Woodbine Entertainment commits to providing an authentic and empowering work experience! Please reach out if you're ready to embrace change and be part of a new breed of experience while working for one of Canada’s certified Great Places to Work!
Show more

title: Saddle Expert & Sales Representative
description:
About Voltaire Design:

Voltaire Design is one of the world’s leading companies in saddle manufacturing, performing operations in over 17 countries. With its heart and primary workshop in the marvelous town of Bidart, located in the southwest of France, Voltaire Design relies on the long French tradition of saddle making. Voltaire Design is the first saddle maker incorporating fashion into its products and also the first environmentally-friendly saddler in the world.

All employees share the same enthusiasm and passion of well-made work and craftsmanship.

Due to expansion of our brand, Voltaire Design is recruiting a new Sport Saddle Specialist for our Alberta territory.

Responsibilities and Duties

  • Represent our brand and develop sales within your territory
  • Be present at all selected Horse Shows, actively searching for new sales opportunities and bringing care to your customers (riders, trainers, barns…) through fittings
  • Manage your inventory of saddles and accessories in a careful and organized manner.

Benefits

  • Base salary & commission structure
  • Health insurance
  • Company car & trailer
  • iPhone & iPad
  • Sales training (two weeks)

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Pay: From $50,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Commission pay

Benefits:

  • Paid time off

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Experience:

  • Outside sales: 3 years (preferred)
  • equestrian: 3 years (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Driving Licence (required)

Willingness to travel:

  • 75% (preferred)

title: K9 Handler- Marine Security Terminals
description:
Do you love Dogs? Do you enjoy a career making a difference? Western K9 Security Services Inc. and Securiguard K9 provide K9 protection and detection services for clients throughout Western Canada. With over 30 years of experience, we are the largest supplier of K9 services in Canada and have provided services to all levels of government, as well as corporations, industry, and other high-profile assignments. Our K9 teams are government certified and licensed in Patrol and Explosive or Narcotics Detection. Our advanced teams train with Canadian and U.S. Law Enforcement, the only private K9 Security teams to do so. Our highly skilled teams work in high profile sites including Ports, Airports, Arenas, Industrial Sites and Remote Locations.


We are currently recruiting for dedicated K9 Handlers to join our team of certified professionals!


Position Summary:

K9 Handlers to perform duties in various locations throughout the lower mainland, with some out of province travel. As a K9 Handler you will first start your career in Patrol. You and your K9 partner will work a variety of days/night shifts. As you progress in your career you may be selected for Detection School. Here you will become a highly skilled K9 operator with opportunities for further career advancement and travel.


Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Provide K9 Patrol/Protection support in accordance with established procedures.
  • Provide Explosive or Narcotic Detection Support as directed by the K9 Operations Manager which may include searching provisions, vehicles, equipment, general facilities etc. in accordance with established procedures.
  • Providing Excellent Customer Services
  • Ability to change schedule when needed and have an open availability.
  • Attend weekly K9 maintenance training.
  • Interior & Exterior Patrols as required, including but not restricted to parking lots, stairwells, hallways, common area facilities.
  • Prepares and maintain documentation to ensure thorough training of assigned canine.
  • Assist and respond to any calls by the K9 Operations Manager for additional service as required.
  • Coordinating & Liaising with Police and other Emergency Services Providers as Required.
  • Providing detailed reports, including occurrence reports, incident reports, and patrol reports as required.

Qualifications:

  • 2+ years of security experience
  • Must have a class 5 driver's license.
  • Must provide a clean driver's abstract and provide abstracts annually.
  • Must have a valid BC security license and maintain their BST security license throughout duration of employment.
  • Must have the ability to attain enhanced security clearance.
  • Must have an open availability.
  • Must be fit to stand/sit/patrol for up to 12 hours per day, carry 50lbs, and walk up and down stairs.
  • Must commit to a 3-month K9 training program.
  • Must have the ability to work outside during inclement weather.
  • Must ensure that deportment is impeccable (includes cleanliness, neatness, high level of personal hygiene)
  • Maintain care for assigned dog in the field or kennels.
  • The ability to take care of K9 after hours and provide a suitable home and friendly environment for a dog.
  • Must have a suitable vehicle to transport K9 to and from work in an approved crate.
  • Must be willing to accept requisite responsibilities for working with or around narcotics/ explosives in a training medium or in an operational environment.
  • Experience and skills to deal with difficult people.
  • Exceptional report writing skills.
  • Customer Service and solutions focused.
  • Ability to work independently or with little or no supervision.
  • Ability to accept direction and guidance (listening skills) follow instructions.

title: Animal care attendant | Equine
description:
The veterinary university hospital is currently looking for candidates to fill temporary positions of equine animal care .

Planned replacement mandate and on call

  • Are you passionate about animal health and well-being?
  • You want to contribute to the mission of the CHUV, the only university veterinary reference center in Quebec, which offers services for many disciplines?
  • You want to evolve in a human workplace, effervescent and flexible?
  • You like to gain new knowledge and enjoy sharing them with your colleagues?

What are you waiting for to leave your footprint at home?

  • Employee discount program including rebates on veterinary services, an employee veterinary account at our main supplier (including discounts on food for Pets), an employee discount for pets medical insurance coverage;

  • One year of full-time relevant work experience with compulsory horses (example: Palefrenier, coach, instructor, marshal-ferran, manipulation of foals and stallions, etc.);
  • You must be available as much day as evening, on shifts 7:45, the week as much as the weekend;
  • only people who meet the requirements of the station will be contacted .

title: Client Care Specialist - Lincoln Animal Hospital
description:
Lincoln Animal Hospital (lincolnanimalhospital.ca) is located in Coquitlam, BC. We are committed to the highest standards of patient care, providing medicine and surgery in a unique, collaborative environment of compassionate and friendly professionals. Our team values work/life balance, offering flexible schedules and a vibrant work environment.

 

About The Role:

Our ideal Client Care/Receptionist builds positive client relationships by displaying genuine care and compassion towards clients and their pets, being respectful in all interactions and providing exceptional customer service. This involves greeting and checking-in clients in a friendly and warm manner; receiving incoming calls from current and prospective clients utilizing a courteous and caring approach. This person will appropriately screen calls, book appointments, take detailed messages as well as provide knowledgeable non-medical information to clients. Responsibilities also include performing a variety of administrative office tasks, including mail (receiving, sorting, distributing, posting), drafting memos and other correspondence, completing reports and other ad-hoc document requests.

This position will also counsel and educate clients, under the direction of a Veterinarian or a RVT, on various aspects of animal care such as dosage/purpose of medications, home care, vaccination requirements, and preventative healthcare recommendations. Additionally, they will also greet, handle and treat animals in a way that contributes to an environment in which animals feel safe and secure.

 

What We Offer:

  • Competitive Base Salary
  • Networking, Collaboration & Knowledge Exchange With Other Veterinarians Within Our Practices
  • Comprehensive Benefits Include: Medical, Dental & Life Insurance
  • Flexible Schedule
  • Vacation & Paid Time Off

 

Meet VetCare:

VetCare (vet-care.ca) is a proudly Canadian-owned acquirer and operator of veterinary practices, based in Vancouver, and with passionate team members across Canada. Our commitment to care is at the heart of what we do, from guiding our talented medical and operations teams, supporting practice owners through seamless transitions, and providing the highest quality of care to patients through our community-focused practices.

title: Caretaker
description:
Position: Caretaker (Part Time, Permanent)
Location: Nelson, British Columbia
Start Date: ASAP

About Us
Tribe Management is part of the Tribe Property Technologies family. Together we are the sixth largest strata/condo and rental management company in Canada with offices in downtown Vancouver, Delta, Victoria, Kelowna, Kamloops, Calgary and Cambridge. Our Tribe Management division specializes in strata and rental management services. We are responsible for the day-to-day operation and management of residential & mixed-use properties in our portfolio. Combining our obsession with technology and an unwavering passion for creating vibrant strata communities, we provide community management with heart. 

Job Responsibilities
The position will be responsible for assisting with the operations of a rental property, which include but are not limited to:

  • Administrative work involved in the operation of the property
  • When necessary, deal with emergencies on a 24hr basis during the workweek
  • Book viewings of suites and interview potential tenants
  • Complete accurate detailed move in/out reports for each tenant and supervise moves to ensure security is maintained
  • Collect, deposit and record all rents
  • Issue notices/ letters to tenants when applicable
  • Comply with regulations as contained in the Residential Tenancy Act
  • Supervise contractors and process invoices in a timely manner
  • Request Purchase Orders for all work and/or supplies being undertaken at the property
  • Prepare detailed Incident Reports related to accidents, altercations and damage to the property and/or other applicable incidents,

Qualifications

  • Motivated and professional
  • Excellent organization and communication skills
  • Detail-oriented
  • Computer literate
  • Able to take direction and work well with minimal supervision
  • Working knowledge of the Residential Tenancy Act an assets

If you are currently exploring a new career challenge in property operations, apply online now. Due to anticipated response, only those candidates who will be interviewed will be contacted.

title: Intermediate Aquatic Specialist
description:
Location

Calgary, AB

Description

Hatfield has been awardedBC’s Top Employers for 2022and we’re looking for more outstanding people to join our team! We do interesting and meaningful work with opportunities for career and professional growth. We also offer a competitive compensation package, flexible work hours, vacation allowances, and comprehensive health benefits including extended health coverage, an employee and family assistance program, and a RRSP matching plan.

Do you want to join a dynamic, science-driven consulting company that prides itself in applying collective expertise to advance environmental stewardship and responsible development? Be part of a team that values technical excellence, creativity, integrity, collaboration, as well as good humour and a supportive work atmosphere.

This full-time position is an exciting opportunity for an experienced and energetic individual to advance their career at a progressive, reputable, and growing consultancy. Hatfield has been in business for 48 years and is now one of the largest independent environmental consultancies headquartered in Western Canada. Hatfield has a strong team of Managers and Partners that will support and guide this position.

Responsibilities:

The successful candidate will provide technical support and assistance on environmental permitting, assessment, and monitoring of projects in Alberta, British Columbia, and northern Canada.

Responsibilities include:

  • Implementing aquatic baseline assessments, operational and compliance monitoring programs, aquatic impact assessments, and habitat offsetting and restoration initiatives.
  • Working with interdisciplinary teams of environmental specialists and technicians to effectively deliver environmental assessment programs in conformance with local, provincial, and federal regulations.
  • Participating in and leading field programs focused on environmental monitoring and assessment of aquatic habitats across Western Canada.
  • Compiling, managing, and interpreting environmental data, and composing technical reports.
  • Providing technical assistance on proposal development, project scheduling, and budget management activities.
  • Providing technical guidance to clients on environmental protection and permitting.
  • Ensuring compliance with Hatfield’s Health and Safety Management Plan, the law, and client health and safety protocols, as well as compliance with Hatfield’s Quality Management Plan and external requirements and regulations.

Education and Experience:

  • Minimum of an undergraduate degree in a relevant environmental discipline, such as fisheries, aquatic ecology, environmental science, or ecotoxicology.
  • Four to eight years of progressive work experience, preferably in a professional consulting context.
  • Relevant professional designation in Alberta or British Columbia, or eligibility for registration.
  • General knowledge of federal and provincial environmental legislation and environmental impact assessment processes.
  • Appropriate qualifications for work in Alberta and British Columbia, and a valid Canadian driver’s license.

Competencies:

  • Ability and interest to work in a dynamic consulting environment that requires flexibility, teamwork, and work in the field, occasionally in remote locations.
  • Exceptional project management skills, including verbal and written communication, technical reporting, budget tracking, and team development.
  • Excellent research and analytical skills (data collection, compilation, and analysis) with a demonstrated ability to consistently apply high standards of scientific rigour to projects and deliverables.
  • Motivated self-starter with a positive attitude and a desire to take on greater responsibility and authority with increasing experience.

Hatfield is committed to employment equity and workplace diversity. We strive for equity, inclusiveness and diversity, irrespective of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression or disability.

To apply, please submit your cover letter and CV describing your experience and salary expectations in confidence through the online form or email:

resumes@hatfieldgroup.catsone.com

(no phone calls please). Please indicate “Intermediate Aquatic Specialist – Calgary” in your subject line. Due to the volume of applicants, only short-listed candidates will be notified but we will retain your resume for any future openings.

title: Animalier(ère) / Réception
description:
QUI SOMMES NOUS ?


Soucieux de préserver l’expertise vétérinaire québécoise et les intérêts économiques du domaine dans la province, sept médecins vétérinaires d’ici se sont alliés en 2014 pour fonder Passionimo. Notre mission ? Être reconnu comme la référence pour la santé et le bien-être de vos animaux. Notre réseau rassemble 34 établissements composés d’un peu plus de 500 professionnels de la santé animale. Ce qui nous unit chez nous, c’est bien évidemment notre dévouement à prodiguer des soins de haute qualité en maintenant un lien de confiance durable avec nos précieux clients.

TEXTE-NOUS! 1-833-265-VETS (8387)

Nous sommes à la recherche d’un(e) : Animalier(ère) / Réception (selon votre intêret)
Lieu du poste : Hôpital vétérinaire Passionimo Carrefour Santé, 199 Rue Beaudry N, Joliette, QC J6E 6A7
Statut du poste : Permanent, temps-plein
Horaire : Flexible 

 

Les défis que nous t’offrons : 


Ce poste pourrait être hybride et vous permettre de faire de la réception, selon votre intêret. 

  • Prodiguer les soins de base aux animaux ;
  • Entretien des cages et du chenil;
  • Faire les contentions de nos petites bêtes;
  • Assister le personnel en radiographie;  
  • Préparer le matériel pour les procédures;
  • Faire le ménage des lieux communs telles que les salles de consultations et chirurgies;
  • Nettoyer les instruments chirurgicaux
  • Faire le remplissage des salles de consultation et de procédures (vaccins, gazes, biscuits, etc.) ;
  • Aider au remplissage des tablettes en boutique ;
  • Défaire la commande, identifier les commandes spéciales, entrer les éléments dans notre logiciel interne ;
  • Faire lentretien quotidien du bâtiment intérieur et extérieur (propreté du stationnement, pelletage des entrées etc.); 

Tu as le profil suivant :  

  • Expérience et/ou formation comme animalier(ère);
  • Maturité et autonomie pour être en mesure de faire des tâches de manière proactive;
  • Sens des responsabilités ;
  • Facilité à travailler seul et en équipe;
  • Aimer les animaux (non négociable)!

Diversité et inclusion

Chez Passionimo, nous aimons les différences. Poils bruns, poils roux, petites ou grandes oreilles, grand chien, petit chats, nos experts sont accessibles à tous, autant aux animaux qu’à leur humain. Il en est de même pour notre capital humain. Passionimo est engagée en faveur de la diversité et de l’inclusion et vise à créer un milieu de travail sain, accessible et gratifiant qui met en valeur la contribution unique de notre capital humain au succès de notre entreprise.



#mesvaleursmacarriere

Become a Wash  Bay Attendant with Go Auto!

title: Concierge
description:
Description

Appartenir à Air Canada, c’est appartenir à un symbole canadien, Air Canada récemment élue meilleur transporteur aérien en Amérique du Nord. Faites décoller votre carrière en vous joignant à notre équipe novatrice et diversifiée à l’avant-garde du transport aérien de passagers. 
 
Le poste se situe près de lAéroport international de Montréal.
 
Un emploi permanent à temps plein est de 40 heures par semaine et un emploi permanent à temps partiel peut être programmé pour un minimum de 20 heures et un maximum de 32 heures par semaine. Le salaire actuel est de 16,56$ l'heure, conformément à la convention collective.

Résumé des fonctions
  • La principale fonction d'un agent du Service Concierge à Air Canada consiste à permettre à nos clients à forte valeur de vivre une expérience des plus agréables à l'aéroport.
  • Ce rôle englobe tous les points essentiels du service offert aux clients à forte valeur, comme l'enregistrement, les salons Feuille d'érable et les services personnels traditionnels.
  • Le poste s'inspire du service de conciergerie d'un hôtel cinq étoiles.
  • Les tâches qui seront confiées au titulaire du poste varieront d'un jour à l'autre, selon les divers besoins de nos clients à forte valeur de statut supérieur.
  • Un agent du Service Concierge se montre toujours serviable, donne toujours suite à une demande et adopte toujours la bonne attitude. L'agent du Service Concierge veille au confort de nos clients à forte valeur et les traite avec tous les égards voulus, simplement en faisant tout le nécessaire pour eux.
Activités principales de l'agent du Service Concierge
  • Relever et examiner les réservations des clients de statut supérieur et de Classe affaires internationale, avant le départ ou l'arrivée de leur vol, pour s'assurer que toutes leurs demandes de services spéciaux ont été traitées.
  • Assurer la parfaite continuité des services pendant tout le voyage en communiquant par le réseau mondial des agents du Service Concierge d'Air Canada.
  • Accueillir et aider tous les clients à forte valeur ou de prestige.
  • Apporter son aide aux clients qui ont des besoins spéciaux.
  • Faire le suivi des correspondances et prendre des mesures proactives pour modifier les réservations, au besoin.
  • Collaborer étroitement avec le service de réservations Air Canada Super Élite et les Relations clientèle pour répondre aux besoins des clients Air Canada Super Élite et régler les manquements au service.
  • Tenir à jour la bibliothèque de documents de référence des agents du Service Concierge et le registre quotidien.
  • Établir un réseau de spécialistes et de ressources pouvant contribuer à répondre aux diverses demandes de nos clients de statut supérieur.

Qualifications

Les candidats doivent avoir le droit de travailler dans le pays choisi au moment où un emploi leur est offert. Il incombe entièrement aux employés posant leur candidature d’obtenir les permis de travail, les visas ou toutes autres autorisations requises pour le poste.
 
Technique :
  • La connaissance et l'expérience en tant qu'agent de vente et de service à la clientèle d'un aéroport seraient considérées comme un atout.
  • Une connaissance supérieure de l'information sur les services des compagnies aériennes et des procédures aéroportuaires serait considérée comme un atout.
  • Connaissance approfondie des attractions, événements, hôtels, restaurants et services de la ville.
  • Une expérience de la billetterie serait considérée comme un atout.
Comportemental :
  • Excellentes compétences en matière de service à la clientèle.
  • Forte volonté de dépasser constamment les attentes des clients tout en offrant un service personnalisé.
  • Attitude proactive et responsable dans la résolution de problèmes avec des solutions créatives.
  • Bon sens du jugement pour trouver un équilibre entre les intérêts des clients et la politique de l'entreprise.
  • Compétences supérieures en matière de leadership et de relations humaines, avec une capacité avérée à travailler en équipe.
  • Motivé(e) et capable de travailler sous pression tout en gérant plusieurs tâches en même temps.
  • Toilette impeccable, excellent sens de l'organisation, grand souci du détail.
  • Excellente fiche de présence.
  • Volonté et capacité de travailler en équipe.
Exigences linguistiques
  • Ce poste exige une bonne maîtrise de la langue.  La priorité sera accordée aux candidats maîtrisant parfaitement l'anglais et le français.
  • Les candidats parlant couramment l'anglais, le français et une ou plusieurs des langues suivantes seront également considérés : Japonais, coréen, cantonais, mandarin, espagnol, italien, allemand, arabe, hébreu, portugais ou grec.
Diversité et inclusion
 
Air Canada est fermement engagée à l'égard de la diversité et de l'inclusion et vise à créer un milieu de travail sain, accessible et enrichissant qui met en valeur les contributions uniques des employés au succès de notre entreprise.
 
En tant qu'employeur souscrivant au principe de l'égalité d'accès à l'emploi, nous accueillons les candidatures de tous pour nous aider à constituer un effectif diversifié qui reflète la diversité de nos clients et des collectivités dans lesquelles nous vivons et que nous servons.
 
Air Canada remercie tous les candidats de leur intérêt ; toutefois, nous ne communiquerons qu'avec les personnes sélectionnées pour poursuivre le processus.
skills: ["Ce poste exige une bonne maîtrise de la langue. \xa0La priorité sera accordée aux candidats maîtrisant parfaitement l'anglais et le français.", 'Attitude proactive et responsable dans la résolution de problèmes avec des solutions créatives.']

title: Cat Sitter
description:
Cat Sitter Toronto is an ever-expanding pet care service company providing the highest standard of pet care and customer service to our clients. We look to ensure clients are never worried about their pets while they are in our care. We are a company that is employee based and we do not use independent contractors. Hiring for all of our service areas. Check www.catsittertoronto.ca for service areas

Cat Sitters we are looking for must:

  • love cats 
  • be able to use our employee software 
  • have excellent customer service skills including interpersonal skills
  • be available to work holidays including Christmas
  • be able to travel within pre-assigned work zones

Responsibilities include:

  •  feeding cats and cleaning used food dishes
  • scooping and disposing of cat litter
  • monitoring pets for health concerns 
  • providing cats with interactive attention 
  • ensuring proper security measures are taken 
  • completion of reports and documentation

Cat Sitter Toronto provides all employees:

  • a supportive management team
  • hourly wages between $15.00 and $20.00 based on services provided
  • a flexible work schedule 
  • opportunity for gratuities and travel incentives
  • the best job ever

title: Concierge
description:
No de la demande d’affichage de poste : 110887

Cintas est à la recherche d’un Concierge pour effectuer le nettoyage de ses installations, à l’intérieur comme à l’extérieur. Le titulaire du poste devra notamment assurer le nettoyage des espaces de bureau, salles de toilettes, salles de repos ainsi que de la section des opérations. La précision et la productivité du travail au quotidien sont nécessaires pour assurer le contrôle des stocks et établir la responsabilité. Le Concierge sera également chargé d’exécuter les travaux d’entretien ménager, de respecter les normes en matière de santé et de sécurité et d’effectuer toute autre tâche jugée nécessaire par la direction.

Exigences

  • Avoir la capacité de se tenir debout et/ou de marcher jusqu'à 7 heures par jour

 

Formation

  • Aucune


Cintas, dont le siège social est situé à Cincinnati, est une entreprise cotée en bourse et négociée sur le Nasdaq Global Select Market sous le symbole CTAS et inscrite aux indices Standard & Poor’s 500 et Nasdaq 100.

Cintas Corporation aide plus de 900 000 entreprises de tous types et de toutes tailles à être PRÊT™ à ouvrir tous les jours leurs portes avec confiance en leur fournissant une large gamme de produits et de services qui rehaussent l’image du client et qui permettent de maintenir leurs installations et leurs employés propres, en sécurité et à leur meilleur. Avec une gamme de produits comme des uniformes, des tapis, des vadrouilles, des fournitures pour salle de bain, des produits de premiers soins et de sécurité en plus de services comme la vérification d’extincteurs et une formation en sécurité et en conformité, Cintas aide les clients à être Prêt pour la Journée de Travail®.

Afin de soutenir notre croissance dans toute l’Amérique du Nord, nous sommes à la recherche de professionnels dynamiques qui souhaitent gravir les échelons organisationnels. Notre culture professionnelle, notre engagement envers nos employés-partenaires et nos occasions de carrière illimitées ne sont que quelques-uns des avantages que nous sommes fiers d’offrir. Nos employés-partenaires savent que chaque rôle est essentiel et que le travail d’équipe stimule l’innovation. Discutons de la façon dont votre intégration au sein de l’équipe ainsi que votre travail acharné seront reconnus par un salaire concurrentiel, des avantages de première classe et de perpétuelles occasions d’avancement de carrière. Êtes-vous Prêt™ pour les occasions illimitées que vous offre Cintas?

En vertu des lois applicables (y compris les droits de la personne et la législation en matière d’accessibilité), des accommodations seront fournies tout au long du processus d’embauche. Les candidats sont requis de faire connaître leurs besoins à l’avance.

Statut de l’employé : Permanent
Horaire de travail : Temps plein
Quart de travail : 1er quart

title: Concierge
description:
Nous recherchons actuellement un Concierge qui serait intéressé à travailler dans une entreprise spécialisée dans le secteur alimentaire

Si vous avez déjà occupé un poste de concierge et que vous avez de l'expérience dans le domaine industriel, notre équipe de Lachine souhaite discuter avec vous .

Avantages
- Quart de jour : $16.48+0.75/hrs du Lundi au Vendredi
- Accessible en transport en commun
- Ben environnement de travail

Responsabilités
Le titulaire du poste de concierge s’assure de la propreté :
1. Dans la cuisine
2. Dans l’usine
3. Dans la section des casiers et vestiaires hommes/femmes
4. Dans les escaliers
5.Toutes les taches connexes

Qualifications
Compétences particulières:
- esprit d’équipe, autonome,
-sens de l’initiative
-organisation efficace

Sommaire
Si vous croyez être la personne que nous recherchons, communiquez avec nous sans tarder, vous pouvez faire parvenir votre CV à yann.bazabas@randstad.ca

Saviez-vous que pour chaque personne que vous nous référez et que nous emploierons durant au moins 4 semaines consécutives ou que nous embaucherons pour un poste permanent, nous vous donnerons un minimum de 50$. Facile, non? Inviter vos amis et votre famille a venir ouvrir un dossier a l'une de nos succursales

Vous ne trouvez pas un poste qui vous intéresse?
Vous recherchez un poste dans le domaine industriel, que ce soit pour un poste de journalier, preparateur de commandes, operateur de machine, cariste

Appelez-nous immediatement au 514-366.2336

N'oubliez pas d'aimer notre page Facebook Randstad Lasalle.

A fin de vous permettre de demeurer a jour au niveau des postes de disponible, je vous invite a télécharger l'application ''MyRandstad'' sur votre téléphone. Grace a l'application, vous serez rapidement informé de tous nos postes disponible et vous serez en mesure de postuler et choisir des quarts de travail qui concorde avec votre horaire.


Yann

téléphone:
514.366.2336
télécopieur:
514.366.2598

Randstad Canada s'engage à favoriser une main-d'œuvre représentative de toutes les populations du Canada. Nous nous engageons en conséquence à développer et à mettre en œuvre des stratégies pour promouvoir l'équité, la diversité et l'inclusion dans toutes nos sphères d'activité en examinant nos politiques, pratiques et systèmes internes tout au long du cycle de vie de notre main-d'œuvre, y compris au niveau du recrutement, de la rétention et de l'avancement pour tout individu. En plus de notre profond engagement sur le respect des principes des droits de la personne, nous nous engageons à prendre toute mesure positive pour influer sur les changements à mettre en place en vue de garantir la participation de tout individu dans le monde du travail et ce, sans obstacle, systémique ou autre, en particulier pour les groupes en quête d'équité généralement sous-représentés dans la main-d'œuvre au Canada, y compris les personnes qui s'identifient comme femmes ou personnes non-binaires/non conformes au genre, les Peuples et communautés autochtones, les personnes en situation de handicap (visible ou invisible), les personnes faisant partie des minorités visibles, les personnes racisées et des communautés LGBTQ2+.

Randstad Canada s'engage à créer et à maintenir un milieu de travail inclusif et accessible pour toutes les personnes candidates et employés en soutenant leurs besoins d'accessibilité et d'accommodation tout au long du cycle de vie de l'emploi. Nous demandons à toutes les personnes demandeuses d'emploi de bien vouloir identifier leurs besoins en matière d'accommodation en envoyant un courriel à

accessibilite@randstad.ca

pour s'assurer de leur capacité à participer pleinement au processus d'entrevue.
